name: Learning through play
description: Alexander Stitt and Bruce Weatherhead’s Zoetrope to Cinemascope educated children about the moving image through posters, cut-outs, puzzles and games, but moving image works have also been used to educate and entertain kids about all aspects of life.

key_work.title: Zoetrope to Cinemascope
key_work.brief_description: Not only did Alex Stitt create the first 3D animated feature film with Abra Cadabra (1983) and animate some of Australia’s most iconic commercials, including ‘Life. Be in it’, he also taught kids through play with books like this one.

constellations_primary.name: Learning through play
constellations_primary.description: Alexander Stitt and Bruce Weatherhead’s Zoetrope to Cinemascope educated children about the moving image through posters, cut-outs, puzzles and games, but moving image works have also been used to educate and entertain kids about all aspects of life.

start.title: Lift Off
start.brief_description: Lift Off was an Australian educational television series that was broadcast on ABC Television from 1992 until the series ended in 1995.

constellations_other.name: Learning through play
constellations_other.description: Alexander Stitt and Bruce Weatherhead’s Zoetrope to Cinemascope educated children about the moving image through posters, cut-outs, puzzles and games, but moving image works have also been used to educate and entertain kids about all aspects of life.

end.title: Storyboarding in Round the Twist
end.brief_description: These hand-drawn VFX storyboards show the creative process behind the Round the Twist episode “Brainless” and they were developed to demonstrate how the visual effects and props – including the Viking Book of Love displayed in the wall case behind you – were to be used in the show.

constellations_other.name: Learning through play
constellations_other.description: Alexander Stitt and Bruce Weatherhead’s Zoetrope to Cinemascope educated children about the moving image through posters, cut-outs, puzzles and games, but moving image works have also been used to educate and entertain kids about all aspects of life.

links.description: Lift Off was written by some of Australia’s best writers, illustrators and animators including Paul Jennings, whose writing also featured prominently in Round the Twist. His works are displayed alongside storyboards and props in The Story of the Moving Image.

start.title: Zoetrope to Cinemascope
start.brief_description: Not only did Alex Stitt create the first 3D animated feature film with Abra Cadabra (1983) and animate some of Australia’s most iconic commercials, including ‘Life. Be in it’, he also taught kids through play with books like this one.

constellations_primary.name: Learning through play
constellations_primary.description: Alexander Stitt and Bruce Weatherhead’s Zoetrope to Cinemascope educated children about the moving image through posters, cut-outs, puzzles and games, but moving image works have also been used to educate and entertain kids about all aspects of life.

end.title: Play School
end.brief_description: Play School is an Australian Gold Logie award-winning educational television show for children. It is the longest-running children’s show in Australia, and the second longest-running children’s show in the world.

constellations_other.name: Learning through play
constellations_other.description: Alexander Stitt and Bruce Weatherhead’s Zoetrope to Cinemascope educated children about the moving image through posters, cut-outs, puzzles and games, but moving image works have also been used to educate and entertain kids about all aspects of life.

constellations_other.name: Taking it slow
constellations_other.description: Daniel Crooks' Phantom Ride offers a meditative journey through digital landscapes that make the viewer pause and reflect.

links.description: Like Zoetrope to Cinemascope, Play School taught kids through fun and engaging entertainment. Its iconic songs, nursery rhymes, storytelling, art and craft, and those iconic windows, were a winning formula for its multi-generational success with its diverse stories showing the ever-changing Australian family.

start.title: Play School
start.brief_description: Play School is an Australian Gold Logie award-winning educational television show for children. It is the longest-running children’s show in Australia, and the second longest-running children’s show in the world.

constellations_other.description: Daniel Crooks' Phantom Ride offers a meditative journey through digital landscapes that make the viewer pause and reflect.

constellations_other.description: Alexander Stitt and Bruce Weatherhead’s Zoetrope to Cinemascope educated children about the moving image through posters, cut-outs, puzzles and games, but moving image works have also been used to educate and entertain kids about all aspects of life.

links.description: The Book Place was an educational reading program that featured the talking puppet ‘Bookworm’, who helped read recently published children’s books to the audience. Similar to Play School, the show also included songs, dances, poems and documentary material showing children and activities.

start.title: Play School
start.brief_description: Play School is an Australian Gold Logie award-winning educational television show for children. It is the longest-running children’s show in Australia, and the second longest-running children’s show in the world.

constellations_other.description: Alexander Stitt and Bruce Weatherhead’s Zoetrope to Cinemascope educated children about the moving image through posters, cut-outs, puzzles and games, but moving image works have also been used to educate and entertain kids about all aspects of life.

constellations_other.description: Daniel Crooks' Phantom Ride offers a meditative journey through digital landscapes that make the viewer pause and reflect.

end.title: Bananas in Pyjamas
end.brief_description: Bananas in Pyjamas is an Australian children’s television show that premiered on 20 July 1992 on ABC. It has since become syndicated in many different countries, and dubbed into other languages.

constellations_other.name: Learning through play
constellations_other.description: Alexander Stitt and Bruce Weatherhead’s Zoetrope to Cinemascope educated children about the moving image through posters, cut-outs, puzzles and games, but moving image works have also been used to educate and entertain kids about all aspects of life.

links.description: After being picked up by the UK version of Play School, the Bananas in Pyjamas were also adopted Down Under. The characters appeared on Play School before embarking on their own live action show that made B1 and B2 household names.

start.title: Little J & Big Cuz
start.brief_description: Little J, he’s five and Big Cuz, she’s nine. They’re a couple of Indigenous Australian kids living with their Nanna and Old Dog.

constellations_primary.name: Little J & Big Cuz to Blade
constellations_primary.description: Discover how some of the best indigenous works connect to comic book blockbusters and martial arts videogames.

constellations_other.name: Learning through play
constellations_other.description: Alexander Stitt and Bruce Weatherhead’s Zoetrope to Cinemascope educated children about the moving image through posters, cut-outs, puzzles and games, but moving image works have also been used to educate and entertain kids about all aspects of life.

end.title: Bluey
end.brief_description: Bluey is an inexhaustible six year-old Blue Heeler dog, who loves to play and turns everyday family life into extraordinary adventures, developing her imagination as well as her mental, physical and emotional resilience.

constellations_other.name: Arrkutja Tharra, Kungka Kutjara, Two Girls
constellations_other.description: Arrkutja Tharra, Kungka Kutjara, Two Girls explores the reality of living in Mparntwe (Alice Springs) through the eyes of the artists, who grew up there. Place and Indigenous representation are also vital to the other works in this Constellation.

constellations_other.name: Learning through play
constellations_other.description: Alexander Stitt and Bruce Weatherhead’s Zoetrope to Cinemascope educated children about the moving image through posters, cut-outs, puzzles and games, but moving image works have also been used to educate and entertain kids about all aspects of life.

constellations_other.name: Native Tongue
constellations_other.description: The lead single off her album of the same name, 'Native Tongue' saw artist Mo'Ju explore cultural identity through music, movement and striking visuals.

links.description: Bluey also uses animation and discovery to bring its characters to life. Bluey, an inexhaustible six-year-old Blue Heeler pup and her family’s extraordinary adventures are aimed at developed children’s imaginations as well as mental, physical and emotional resilience.

constellations_other.name: Learning through play
constellations_other.description: Alexander Stitt and Bruce Weatherhead’s Zoetrope to Cinemascope educated children about the moving image through posters, cut-outs, puzzles and games, but moving image works have also been used to educate and entertain kids about all aspects of life.

end.title: Little J & Big Cuz
end.brief_description: Little J, he’s five and Big Cuz, she’s nine. They’re a couple of Indigenous Australian kids living with their Nanna and Old Dog.

constellations_primary.name: Little J & Big Cuz to Blade
constellations_primary.description: Discover how some of the best indigenous works connect to comic book blockbusters and martial arts videogames.

constellations_other.name: Learning through play
constellations_other.description: Alexander Stitt and Bruce Weatherhead’s Zoetrope to Cinemascope educated children about the moving image through posters, cut-outs, puzzles and games, but moving image works have also been used to educate and entertain kids about all aspects of life.

links.description: The Book Place was one of the first children’s shows to feature the Kaurna language, with Alice Rigney singing Kammammi’s Lullaby. The first Indigenous animated series, Little J & Big Cuz also teaches language and culture with episodes produced in different Indigenous languages.

constellations_other.name: Learning through play
constellations_other.description: Alexander Stitt and Bruce Weatherhead’s Zoetrope to Cinemascope educated children about the moving image through posters, cut-outs, puzzles and games, but moving image works have also been used to educate and entertain kids about all aspects of life.

end.title: Lift Off
end.brief_description: Lift Off was an Australian educational television series that was broadcast on ABC Television from 1992 until the series ended in 1995.

constellations_other.name: Learning through play
constellations_other.description: Alexander Stitt and Bruce Weatherhead’s Zoetrope to Cinemascope educated children about the moving image through posters, cut-outs, puzzles and games, but moving image works have also been used to educate and entertain kids about all aspects of life.

links.description: Lift Off also fostered children’s early development through animation, drama, performance, puppetry and documentary. It showed a wide variety of different environments, worlds, peoples, animals and plants all presented as accessible and exciting but requiring understanding, empathy and care.
